Apparently, the NAACP doesn't know that President's Day was created to consolidate the celebration of the birthdays of two great Presidents...Abraham Lincoln and George Washington. It is not to honor all Presidents. It is not to honor Presidents that have not proven themselves to be great leaders.
 
 Be careful! Anything and everything said or done to indicate lack of acknowledgment of BHO's greatness will be considered RACISM.
 
 
 
 Obama's picture removed from Peterson's President's Day sign | presidents, obama, commissary - Top Stories - Colorado Springs Gazette, CO
 
 President Barack Obama's picture was removed this week from a Presidents Day sign at the Peterson Air Force Base commissary after customers complained that the image did not fit the holiday commemorating the birthdays of past presidents George Washington and Abraham Lincoln.
 
 The head of the local NAACP and a commissary employee say it was blatant racism.

Huh?
 
 What is your point?
My point is that the NAACP will jump at any chance to cry of racism...even when there is none. Did you bother to read the article?

My point is that the NAACP will jump at any chance to cry of racism...even when there is none. Did you bother to read the article?

 
 Did you?
 
A cashier at the commissary who did not want her name used said pictures of past presidents, including George W. Bush and Bill Clinton, have accompanied the Presidents Day closure sign.
 
 One customer, a military retiree, objected this year because of Obama's race, the cashier said.
 
 "He said they're not going to have no black man on the window where he shops," the cashier said.
 
 

 
 Sure, no racism there at all...

Did you?
 
 
 Sure, no racism there at all...

 
 Yes. Apparently you didn't. Just below that lie by the cashier is a statement of the manager that says it never happened.
 
 Perhaps you need to hone your reading skills...or get over the personality conflict you apparently have with me.
 
 
A cashier at the commissary who did not want her name used said pictures of past presidents, including George W. Bush and Bill Clinton, have accompanied the Presidents Day closure sign.
 
 One customer, a military retiree, objected this year because of Obama's race, the cashier said.
 
 "He said they're not going to have no black man on the window where he shops," the cashier said.
 
 The commissary agency disputed the cashier's story, saying no past presidents have had their picture displayed with the holiday message.

 
 
 One'll get you a hundred if the cashier isn't a disgruntled black female. Maybe she can get Al Sharpton to represent her in a bogus lawsuit.

This is a classic case of people with apparently too much time on their hands...and during a recession no less.
 
 Frankly the customer should have not cared and the NAACP should have not cared. 
 
 All we have are two people/groups of #####(s).
